FuncDef: The reset ipv6 neighbors command clears dynamic IPv6 ND entries. The reset ipv6 neighbors command clears dynamic IPv6 ND entries. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Clears dynamic ND entries on all interfaces.
-

Clears all dynamic ND entries on a specified interface.
-

Clears dynamic ND entries on a specified interface.
-

Clears dynamic ND entries of a specified VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Clears dynamic ND entries with a specified IPv6 address on a specified interface.
The address is a 32-bit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: If the number of dynamic ND entries exceeds the upper threshold, run the reset ipv6 neighbors command to delete unwanted dynamic ND entries.
